website_summaries.verdict: A roomy smart feeder that comes with some of the usual frustrations for this type of unit, but is very effective when it's working properly.
pros: Allows you to control your pet's portions with its handy Smart Feed app
Hopper holds an impressive 24 cups of food
Works with some of the latest iPhone and Android smartphones
cons: App or connectivity issues that require contacting customer service have been reported

website_summaries.verdict: You can control this feeder remotely with a smartphone app for exact feeding times. Many who work long hours like it for daily use, but they don't recommend it during lengthy trips without backup.
pros: Compatible with iPhone iOS 9.0 or later and Android phones 5.0 or later
Can program up to 12 meal times
Dispenses 1/8 cup to 4 cups for different pets
Slow feed option releases slowly over 15 minutes
Feeds on schedule even if WiFi signal is lost
Lid, bowl, bowl holder, and hopper are dishwasher safe
cons: Pricey, and the WiFi connection and app are not always reliable

customer_reviews.title: Smart kitty presses the button himself.
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Kitties love it too. Of course, Dave figured out how to feed himself within a week of its arrival. The app on my phone kept going off saying my pet had been fed?!?! (Like 10 times in 10 minutes.). Stinker. Have to admit, I was impressed. See pics for the simple fix. Not pretty, but does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Annarita

customer_reviews.title: A 5+ becomes a 0
customer_reviews.text: I would normally give this a 5+! It was the best product I’ve ever used. I LOVE the app. BUT less than 3 months the red lite came on saying there is a jam. After removing every kibble we could see, it is still indicating a jam. This is a lot of $$$$ for problems out of no where in less than 3 months wouldn’t you say?!!!
customer_reviews.author: Terriod

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service for a faulty machine
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these for our 2 dogs, and the timing on one of the feeders is off. So one of them dispenses good later than the other (despite us setting them to go off at the exact same time). This has been a problem because by the time one of our dogs is finished eating, the other dog’s food is being dispensed, and the first dog is eating our other dog’s food. I have contacted the company twice, and they have promised to contact their tech people to call me. No one has. What a waste of a huge amount of money! Terrible customer service. We will never purchase from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Bialke

customer_reviews.title: Customer Support Number Disconnected
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today. Setup was seemingly straight forward until the app decided that I must call customer support. It covers the entire control screen with a message telling me to call customer support with a button to “Call now”. Pressing the button does nothing and the error does not go away. Even after deleting and reinstalling the app, and running through the entire setup process again, it still displays the error. Good luck trying to call the support number listed on their website. It is disconnected.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Steele

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT CONNECT TO WiFi
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for the first four to six weeks. Since then, I have been on & off the phone for long periods of time with multiple Customer Service Specialists for av few weeks, at leeway, trying to troubleshoot the problem. They even sent me a new machine, and it, too, does not work. They also told me they would also escalate my trouble-shooting ticket to the next Level of expertise specifically for this product. I have yet to hear from anyone after several phone calls and it's been over a week. I'm sorry to say, but even though I was happy at the prospect of this product helping my family, the bottom line, is I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dionna McLean

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working While We Were on Vacation
customer_reviews.text: The PetSafe Smart Feed Automatic Feeder is NOT reliable. Do not leave your pets along for and extended period without some sort of backup. We went on a week long vacation and I ended up hiring a pet sitter because the feeder was only dropping maybe 3 kibbles out of the feeder at a time. That was definitely not working for my 3 chihuahuas. Not reliable. When I read reviews before buying, I saw lots of people who go out of town for work who depend on this thing. I would never trust it again.
customer_reviews.author: TLGon2info

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily. Bad design.
customer_reviews.text: Product stopped working. Technical support at Petsmart worse than useless. Now stuck with a broken unit that doesn’t work. Extremely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in two months, totally broken now.
customer_reviews.text: Cat food fell down inside the feeder, jammed up the gears, and eventually the regulator that governs how long to run the belt broke, this thing is now a $200 door stop (and it's terrible at that because it's so light, once you shake the catfood out of the gear works). Can't believe what a cheap piece of trash it is; for something so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Weatherford

customer_reviews.title: Great product...but there is one thing you must know to get the Android app to work
customer_reviews.text: Turn off the phone's "mobile data", while the home WiFi is on. You can then download and install PetSafe Smart Feed app. When adding a new smart feed device, reset it by using a paper clip into the reset hole just above the big white button on the device for bout 10 seconds or until the big white button stops blinking for couple of seconds. Te app will guide you to change phone's WiFi to PetSafe, then switch back to its app. At this point you should see a "Continue" button. The rest is intuitive. The hardware appears to be engineered well. Once the device is online, you can turn on the "mobile data".
customer_reviews.author: Erol Esen

customer_reviews.title: No more mealtime meowing
customer_reviews.text: I've considered getting this feeder for awhile now, and I'm so happy I finally did. The last straw was kitty's recently increased mealtime meowing (yowling) which has now completely stopped! Also so convenient that I can leave home for a whole day without relying on someone else to feed kitty. 4 stars for better design - kitty had this thing flipped over, lid unlocked, and ate to his hearts content the very first day... (Currently have heavy items wedged on the sides and top which works for now, but planning to build a wooden enclosure around the machine to keep kitty out) Also wish there was a sensor for food level so app would notify when low.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie M

customer_reviews.title: I like the concept behind the product
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept behind the product. It's just not working for me. After endless disconnects from my router, I'm done with this unit! There are countless of automatic feeders w/cameras now but I refused to go with them because of all the terrible reviews (Play Store) regarding connectivity issues! Now here I am with a product I had hoped came from a reputable manufacturer but it does not... I'm sending this thing back. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Able to increase number of daily feedings while decreasing total daily amount easily
customer_reviews.text: My cats are no longer food w__res crowding around the bowl whenever we walk to the kitchen, even though we fed them twice a day 1/4c each. That’s two cats, so a full cup a day. After we got this thing, I ended up cutting them back to three 1/4c feedings a day, adding a noon feeding when I’m not home, for 3/4c total, AND they no longer “beg” for food. Sometimes they run to the machine when they hear it, other times they couldn’t care less. I suppose if I only got two meals 12h apart I’d be pretty hungry most of the time too.
customer_reviews.author: Light Maleski

customer_reviews.title: needed manual reset within 3 days
customer_reviews.text: I bought this feeder with the idea that it would be good for emergencies like if there was an earthquake, since it has a battery backup. A couple days after setting it up there was a short power outage in my neighborhood, which knocked my Wifi & router offline for maybe a few minutes. After that the feeder wouldn't work without being set up again using my smartphone. If you want an unreliable product, maybe this one is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder
customer_reviews.text: I really like this Feeder. For all of the people saying it doesn't dispense with its offline, I don't have that issue. It works like normal. For all of the people saying their cat can hit the button at the top, there's a setting in the app for child lock.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen O'Bryan

customer_reviews.title: WiFi Not Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have given up on this feeder and Petsafe. After 9 months this thing won’t stay connected to my WiFi network. I connect it and 10 minutes later it drops off. I have many things connected to my WiFi network; Hue lights, Sonos, Echo Dots, my oven thermometer, my computer, my iPhone, my iPad...All of them work flawlessly. Yet Petsafe tells me the problem is with my router. This was after 3 days of trying in vain to contact Petsafe Customer Service. Steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle J. Warendorf

customer_reviews.title: Can't connect more than one phone
customer_reviews.text: Me and my partner both like this smart feeder and it is easy to program however we can't seem to both be connected to it on our phones. If one of us is connected it kicks the other phone off and vice versa. I bought this July 2019. Just recently I bought the splitter accessory since we now have two cats. Shortly after, the feeder stopped working even after multiple resets Petsafe customer service is sending me a replacement refurbished feeder. It won't come with a warranty which is sort of unfair imo since my feeder is still under warranty Probably won't buy another petsafe product
customer_reviews.author: Splaty

customer_reviews.title: Great cat feeder
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with my petnet feeder for many years until they recently had financial issues and couldn't use the feeder. I took a chance on this feeder. Much nicer design. Being able to see the food level through the top, the bowl is easier to remove and clean. the way it dispenses is much better for not jamming up compared to my old one. The notifications seem to work well also. I like the slow feed option also.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix User

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working. Poor Pup keeps missing meals
customer_reviews.text: Updated on 6/25/19 - One of our 2 machines isn't working consistently. It will work fine for a day or 2, then we'll notice that the other machine is a lot lower on food so obviously the first one isn't actually dispensing food each time. There's no error code so we dont know when our poor dog is being starved. First 2 months: Took about 3 days for my dogs to get over being terrified of the feeder. At first the sound really scared them. Now they go running when they hear it turn itself on. No issues thus far and we've been using them for about 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: It’s big and loud.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a cat. It’s a big bulky unit. Much bulkier than I imagined. I understand why though - this would be a great unit for a medium to large sized dog since it would be harder to tip over and just had more mass than a lot of other units on the market. That said my gripe with is wasn’t so much size for my single cat, it was that the design is such that when food is dispensed it makes a loud clanging sound as the food hits the metal bowl. I have owned other feeders and this is not so much an issue. It an annoyance but probably not a deal breaker for most.
customer_reviews.author: Ryeguy

customer_reviews.title: Got Faulty Unit, Petsafe Replaced It
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work great. I love the several meal time and amount options. But the second day I had it, after mixing some dry food in the hopper then priming, it pops up with errors. The cats are still getting fed but the errors on the second day are pretty annoying. Hopper will need to be emptied prior to opening which seems like a giant pain. Update: sent an email to petsafe customer support. They were prompt and sent me a replacement at no charge which came in the mail after a few days. So far the replacement is working great.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great automatic feeder
customer_reviews.text: We recently got a Dachshund puppy and wanted to make sure he ate a controlled diet. We also wanted to make sure it was at the same time each day as well as ensuring if we were not home would be feed. This unit connected to our wifi easily and without incident. The iOS application has been rock-steady and very easy to use. Being a puppy, I found I had to calibrate the unit with the food I was using (it is very small pieces). Once I know how much each dump was, it has been very consistent on food delivery. I would buy it again without any hesitation. Works as expected and without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: CraigB

customer_reviews.title: Wifi went out in under a year
customer_reviews.text: Did love it but thewent out in it in under a year and since I bought on amazon I cant return it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Wulff

customer_reviews.title: Reliable feeder with weird, rare glitches
customer_reviews.text: Does what it should 99% of the time, however sometimes it would randomly feed my pet snacks (lock was enabled). So either the lock failed or the programming failed and it did a mis-feed. Another bad thing is my power got reset due to some work in my building - the WiFi came back online but the feeder had not connected back to the WiFi. I waited a few days but it never reconnected and I had to fix it manually (but the battery backup kept it feeding my pet)
customer_reviews.author: G Money

customer_reviews.title: Sadly doesn’t work. Fix this I will buy the next one
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this thing to work. Heck I would have paid more for it if it had. My Problem is I have a large Labrador who eats a lot. The feeder (although set on large servings) does not feed the correct amount out. I can hear the Motor moving and small bits come out but then it stops. The machine thinks food if being dispensed when I’m actuality.. it is not.
customer_reviews.author: I speak the truth

customer_reviews.title: Love the product but portion size is too large for us
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea that I can push a button and dispense a snack. This feature worked great. However, I got this specifically for my cat with IBD who has to have small portions. I was hoping to be able remotely dispense between meal snacks. However the smallest portion (1/8 cup) is too large for her to have. I saw another reviewer left the same comment but I was hoping that because her dry food is quite large and chunky that it wouldn't be the case for us. I hope they keep refining this product because the Smart Feeder is a nice step up from just a simple timed feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Jellicle

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: I work late on some nights, and found it difficult to make sure my dogs were getting enough food before I got home. We bought this and my husband made a splitter for it, and BOOM- pups no longer have to wait for my return at night for dinner! It also helps when they are hungry in the morning. I set timers for breakfast, a snack, and dinner all from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: KristinTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Solid build quality, but this thing is constantly losing connection to WiFi, which has apparently resulted in it not dispensing feedings at all for whatever reason. There have been days if not weeks at a time where my cat was not getting fed in the morning. I’ve done all the troubleshooting of moving physical location etc. The WiFi is just inherently faulty on this feeder, when it works it works great. But I cannot reliably depend on it.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS... and don't waste your money on the cheaper stuff.
customer_reviews.text: The Petsafe feeder has been working great for me for over 2 months. Portions are always correct, and the cats are always fed. I also bought the splitter and this is great, skinny is actually getting a chance to eat before getting pushed away by fattie. The way it feeds the food in on the belt, the cats cant reach in and help themselves. I have bought 2 other auto feeders, both were not reliable, sometime would be light sometimes wouldn't feed at all, and both very easy for fattie cat to help himself.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Campbell

customer_reviews.title: I think the bowl is too deep for most cats
customer_reviews.text: My cat doesn't really like the bowl, I think. After I placed a more shallow bowl next to the feeder, then he started trying to get the food. Also, the unit itself obstructs about 20% of the bowl, so I think the cat hits his head on the unit when he tries to feed. The design should have placed the bowl farther out, in my opinon. Also, the autofeeder I had before really was accurate with its portion. I'm selecting an 1/8 of a cup, and it's more like a half cup.
customer_reviews.author: Mark V

customer_reviews.title: Better
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so you can buy an automatic cat feeder for less than $50. Why get this? Well, first, nobody "needs" this. But if you're already looking at an autofeeder and the price didn't immediately make you nope right on out, then the extra connectivity and general good design of this feeder really are a step up for just programming a schedule that never deviates. This gives you control to just plop out a little more but also just enough tracking to know then your three year old just pressing the feed button over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Charles B.

customer_reviews.title: Great help to regulate cat's feeding
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a way to help my cat lose weight and slow overeating. Set schedules each day make feeding an easy chore. I simply assure the feeder is full at the beginning of the week, and it does the job. Took about a day or so for the cat to become familiar with the sound and newness, but it works great and my cat's health has improved.
customer_reviews.author: Tish

customer_reviews.title: Best smart feeder for its price.
customer_reviews.text: Best smart feeder you will find out there! I have an overweighted dog and I was struggling to feed him on schedule by portions every day as recommended by the vet. With this feeder I can set schedule feeds with properly measured portions every single time, all from the mobile app on my phone. The feeder sends me notifications when his food is being served, so I know he ate. It’s just amazing. It has a battery backup (4 D cell batteries, not included) for power loss occasions so you can go out knowing that even if the power goes out, your pet won’t starve. It has settings for both dogs and cats!
customer_reviews.author: Sons Lestat

customer_reviews.title: Food Dispenser
customer_reviews.text: For the most part this machine is great! I figured out the child lock so the smarties don't feed themselves. Now my fat cat is putting her paw in the tunnel where the food comes from and all that is stopping the food from coming down is a rubber stopper. If you reach in you can feel and if you lift it up a bit you can release a couple of kibbles at a time, just like my fatty does. Wish there was a fix for this.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Well designed!
customer_reviews.text: Reliable and efficient and my two Russian Blue cats can't get into it at all! Every other auto feeder they've been able to open or paw up into it enough to get food out! We only use this when we are away or if they are extra hungry and begging for a snack in the middle of the night after running around like wild cats. Otherwise they have difficult, puzzle and hunting feeders where they have to work for their food, so as soon as they hear the clinking of the food in the metal bowl, they take off! Awesome job with making this one!
customer_reviews.author: S. Vigil

customer_reviews.title: Defective upon arrival-solid red indicator light
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 2nd generation pet safe feeder in hopes that I could use Alexa with it. Considering how expensive it is, I was sorely disappointed. As soon as I pressed the button to prime the machine, a solid red light came on indicating mechanical error or feeder jam. Despite fiddling with the unit for quite some time, it was still showing motor error. I am returning and giving this one more chance and requested a replacement. If the second one works beautifully I will reconsider this review. If not buyer beware!!!! I will post update
customer_reviews.author: chown

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases ever made!
customer_reviews.text: Really helped make feeding time less stressful. It keeps me consistent with feeding times and takes out the excitement and jumping and barking at me at meal time. The pup loves this bowl. She knows when it's time to eat and she sits next to it antipatating her dinner waiting patiently to be served. Programming was super easy from the phone. I haven't used the Alexa feature or the Amazon Dash as I haven't been able to find her food on Amazon. But she eats Purina Pro (Focus) Puppy food...weve had no problems with that food dispensing. I get a message that lets me know she's been fed.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent automatic feeder for cats or dogs
customer_reviews.text: We have three of these and absolutely love them. The dog has her own and we have four cats that share the other two using the 3D printed Y peace available from another seller. the feature to electronically lockout the dispensing button is critical as my cats quickly figured out how to dispense food themselves. the battery backup is also another great feature as well as the alarm mean that you'll get if it does not dispense. The only thing that's missing would be something that would tell you the level of food in it.
customer_reviews.author: Raychael C

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder! Make sure you have food in bin.
customer_reviews.text: You would want to make sure you have the batteries as back up. If your internet faults the batteries would allow your cats/dogs to be fed. This petfeeder is great. However, if there's no food in the bin the feeder will still cycle and send you an alert that your pet has been fed. You will be alerted by your fur baby if they are hungry when you get home (hopefully that same day). Hopefully they will come out with a new model with a low food level indicator. I am happy with this product but if I find another device with a low food indicator I would buy that and sell this one.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Practical
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two feeders (one for my indoor cat and a second one for the outdoor cats). The only issue I have is that the battery backup compartment does not have a tray in the event the battery bleeds (avoiding wood floors damage). I decided to use the feeder without the battery backup feature just in case. I hope the manufacturer includes a battery backup tray in the next upgrade. 4 stars until a tray is included in the next upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Works Great! Cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: This machine is convenient to set up and use. The app is user friendly and I never had issues with it except like once in the past year I have it (restarted app and it recovered). The configuration is flexible, specifying times and how much to feed etc... Design is sleek. Honestly I have nothing to complain about, and neither does my cat. I recommended it to my friend who owns 2 cats and it worked really well for them too. He purchased an add on splitter chute thing so he can have the food dispensed into 2 separate bowls.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: A breeze to set up, works great, no jams!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace petnet feeders that both died within a week of each other. I was dreading setting up a new feeder, but this petsafe feeder was SO easy to set up. 5 minutes maybe. It got online easily and all feeds have worked perfectly, both manual and scheduled. I’m hoping the conveyer belt system work better than the petnet mechanism which jammed until it died. Now I may have to get another one since my two cats apparently can’t share a bowl. So far, this feeder is fantastic, I’ll update if it changes. Currently I’ve only had it for 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Kenney

customer_reviews.title: Bit pricy but... well worth it if you travel.
customer_reviews.text: Life saver for a cat owner. Got it up to go out of town for a week and sure enough... power goes out for two days at the house while I was on the other side of the country and my cat was still fed with the battery backup. This will keep programmed after it is set up, if your internet connection goes out it will not miss its feed. Been using this for about a month now and not one jam thus far. Will update if anything goes wrong, but keep it up petsafe. Good product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the extra money to get this one.
customer_reviews.text: The other brands that use the screw function seem to be very prone to breakage. This one uses a conveyor belt that seems less likely to break to me. I have had it running none stop for several months now and have had zero issues with it. I can make adjustments very easily with my phone from anywhere. My cat is over weight so I use this to ensure a precise time and amount of feeding. I also go away for some long weekends and rather than leave her with a huge bowl of food that she will eat way too much of I can ensure she gets the proper feeding everyday. I love this machine.
customer_reviews.author: bicklestiny

customer_reviews.title: Life is such easier with this feeder
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first but this feeder is perfect. In the rush of the day we would often ask did we feed the cat. Well with this feeder that question is no longer an issue. It was easy to setup and the app alerts you when your pet is fed. Additionally, this worked great when we out for weekend travel, no need to call someone to come by and feed the cat. One more thing I like the idea of adjusting the amount you feed the cat or slow feed option.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gaines

customer_reviews.title: Don't lose connection
customer_reviews.text: The feeder works, but won't reconnect if it loses signal. If the feeder loses connection, you must add the feeder in the app again. It won't restore the connection itself. You must repeat setup instructions each time. This means that it will lose all settings that you previously programmed. At least it continues feeding at the previously programmed times so that if you're out of town, it will still feed. There have also been times when the app has failed to add the feeder until the 20th time. The other gripe is that it can only be connected to one phone. If I connect her phone, mine no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: Kos

customer_reviews.title: Android App Will Not Connect to Feeder
customer_reviews.text: The setup process is to turn on the feeder and the manual feed button should blink white. Check. Download the Smart Feed app from the Google Play Store. Check. Sign in to the app with an e-mail address. Check. Get a six digit code by e-mail to enter into the app. Check. In the app, add a feeder. Check. App says to connect the phone's WiFi to the feeder's access point. Check. App says it will connect automatically. Nope. Power the feeder off and on. Nope. Get paperclip to reset the feeder. Nope. Reboot phone. Nope. Get scoop and feed hungry cat by hand. Check.
customer_reviews.author: DRG

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. I bought this for my 2 cats
customer_reviews.text: This is so convenient! I set up a Nest Camera to make sure this feeder was doing its job! It was! But I the racoon and magpies that were stealing food and captured on camera had to be dealt with! This is a great product. I bought this for my 2 cats, but I'm considering getting another for my dog. You can set it up to feed your animals several times a day if needed and you get to choose the amount to be fed! Genius!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Mitchell Kerrr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: We really love this for our cats! They both share the bowl no problem and now wait for the sound of the motor to know it’s time to eat! You can easily feed a small snack too from your phone or by pushing the button on the feeder (there’s a child lock feature on the button to disable it if needed). We’ve had this feeder since Christmas and only had an issue when our WiFi was acting up or if the wall plug was bumped. The app does alert you if they’ve been fed though so you’ll know if it’s working. Also, it’s been great for portion control for our fat cat and we go through a lot less food!
customer_reviews.author: Standiford

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Feeder!!!
customer_reviews.text: This feeder has been Outstanding! My dog must eat every six hrs or she will get vomit bile. This feeder has been a life saver for the late nights, early mornings, etc. Only one minor jam since I've had for 10+ months. I would highly recommended this feeder. I had the Feed and GO feeder which closed their company. The feeder malfunctioned often and disconnected from the wifi once a week. This one has been quite the opposite experience, THANK YOU PetSafe!
customer_reviews.author: Netranger

customer_reviews.title: 1 week in and loving it
customer_reviews.text: Now I have only used for a week but this was super easy to set up and works great. It is noisy when it drops the food but mine is in the kitchen and no big deal to me. I have 3 cats and the youngest would always eat to much and puke everywhere. Now it is easy to do several small portions all day and my youngest kitty isn't puking anymore because she has no self control, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin D. Hazelton

customer_reviews.title: Great use of design and technology to feed pets. Careful of the blue button on top.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it yesterday. 1/8 cup is smallest portion you can serve at a time. 1/4 cup is the smallest portion you can set using the slow feed mode which completes in 15-minuets. It's pretty slick but the dish detaches fairly easily; at least my 2 kittens didn't have a problem dislodging it. I ordered the 2-way splitter so that won't be a problem down the line. One problem. My 2 kittens climbed atop the unit and pressed the very attractive bright and flashy illuminated blue button. In turn, they got there just rewards with some kibble splashing down into the dish. Is there some way to fix this problem?
customer_reviews.author: Denga

customer_reviews.title: A bit bulky in design but works great
customer_reviews.text: we have this setup in our kitchen. the app and the machine itself has worked out well and is very consisitant on feeding times. the only thing we are having issues is the bowl is somewhat tucked in under where it feeds so our furry friend is having trouble having eatting access to the entire bowl. it would be nice if maybe there was a chute or slide of sorts to keep the food to one side of the bowl or at least not tucked under the machine.
customer_reviews.author: j. lee

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, easy app, easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Im so glad I got this feeder. I have cats and one loves to eat way more than she needs. So “free-feeding” has never been an option. I bought this because sometimes I’ll go out of town for maybe a full day, i felt they didn’t need a sitter. But, I didn’t want to leave food out and they overeat. So I just program the time and it feeds them! I also keep it hooked up without the set timer in case I’m running late getting home. I’ll log onto my app and hit “feed” to make sure they eat at the time they’re used to!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Almost a 4 star rating bc...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased new, it came either tested or was used. The packaging was worn and it clearly had been opened before. The feeder itself smelled like pet food and still had particles in the chamber. However, it works perfectly and is easy to use. My cats come running (as pictured) when they hear the food hit the pan. I purchased the splitter adapter, separately, for two reasons: 1. To separate the food 2. To keep the food from forming a pile under where it despenses out. Everything pictured (except Remus) was purchased on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully
customer_reviews.text: At first the sound scared the cats, but they got used to it. We love that we can trust this to fill their bowl daily. We’ve since gone out of town for 5 days without having anyone needing to stop by to feed them. We had a camera on this to ensure it, but it worked out wonderfully. The cats are now eating what they’re supposed to so they seem hungry more often. But they could afford to lose some weight
customer_reviews.author: R. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Reliable automatic feeder
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. My cats are older and can only eat a bit of food at a time. Since we can’t be around all the time to feed them this is so helpful. The downside of this product is the metal feeding bowl! I have this set for the middle of the night and early morning (to keep them from waking us up when they are hungry) but the metal bowl makes such a clanging Sound when the feed falls in. Would much rather plastic or another, quieter material
customer_reviews.author: JavaGirl

customer_reviews.title: Big dog food kibble won’t work. Not changing foods because of this.
customer_reviews.text: I feed my puppy Science Diet Large Breed puppy food. My job during certain times of the year required me to work a lot of overtime so I got this to keep the puppy on the same schedule of eating. This product worked great at first but I began to notice the puppy has been getting skinny and pulling his hair around the hip area. One morning I was home and heard the feeder kick on and I heard it only dropped like a handful of kibble which isn’t even close to what he needs. Tonight I just tried giving him a snack from it it ran but nothing came out and no jam signal or anything.
customer_reviews.author: CMOR

customer_reviews.title: Junk components, unreliable smart features, pass on this garbage
customer_reviews.text: Read the negative reviews. Difficult to connect to phone, constant smart feature errors, internal drive motor finally permanently jammed and wouldn't work after a couple tries getting it set up (due to a bad design, it literally jams on small sized, dry cat kibble). I opened it up and it's basically 20 bucks worth of cheap parts inside. I understand that what you really pay for is the smart features, but those don't work either. Complete scam.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Feeder
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this feeder! I do not have to worry about not filling up the food bowl and can give treats throughout the day! Also, I never have to worry about the power going out or the plug getting disconnected, which happened a few times. This feeder was very well thought out and seems to have addressed every pet owner's concern.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Lim

customer_reviews.title: Cat's don't jump on our faces in the morning waiting for breakfast anymore!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. It feeds the cats for us in the morning so that they let us sleep in a little. We also have it set to feed them at 6pm, a couple hours before we give them wet food for dinner. I've had it set up to dispense into various slow-eating puzzles, but currently it just has a simple ramp on the dispenser end that spreads the food all over the floor and lets the 2 cats spread out and not get in eachothers space... of course it comes with a bowl that most people will probably prefer to use.
customer_reviews.author: Greenhouse

customer_reviews.title: Fire Hazard?!!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved these at first. It was nice to get the notifications that my cats were being fed while I was out. However while I was home I received a notification that one of my feeders was running on the batteries. No power outages had happened. I went to investigate and released that the feeder was smoking?! I unplugged from the wall and immediately pulled the batteries out. The front of the machine was hot. Luckily I was home at the time. I will be reaching out to amazon or petsafe to return my two feeders as I will not trust something if it randomly starts to smoke. I have only had these feeders for 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Solid app and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what we needed. Instead of waiting for us to wake up each morning our cats get fed at 5am. I would suggest some other future features though. Feed by RFID (microchip). Our 1 year old will eat all of the food leaving our 10 year old cat hungry. Schedule feeding is good but feeding limits based upon proximity would be good too. Also would be nice to have a food scale to remind you to order more food. Other than that it's amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Proline Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the Money or Time
customer_reviews.text: Feeder constantly kept gettng jammed. I had to remove all the food and reset the thing and try again but it would work for a little bit and it would get jammed again. 98% of the time this product stayed jammed.
customer_reviews.author: ChiragParikh

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This product is good for weekend trips. I would t use it for long trips. I left for a trip for a week and by the 3rd day it sent me a notification that there was a problem with the feeder. My poor pet would have gone with a few more days of not eating. I had to overnight my keys to friends so they can feed my pet enough food. It’s very disappointing to spend all of this money and it’s not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Christine L.

customer_reviews.title: Broke two weeks after 30 day return period.  Works fine before that.
customer_reviews.text: App is fine, appliance works when it works. Mine broke suddenly, and there wasn't a troubleshooting guide or any way to try and fix it. Obviously isn't worth the money to me, maybe you'll get lucky. Portion control was convenient. I guess I'll just get out the cup measure, those only cost a dollar!
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Best Autofeeder
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly easy to setup and schedule feeding times. Unit seems durable and have used it a few days now. Quality looks excellent. Large lid for easy filling from food bag. no need for a recorded voice as my cats hear the jingle when the food drops in. I was leery of the other brands, the reviews were fairly split from good to bad. I picked this one because of who responded promptly to poor reviews. I also like getting notified that the cats have been feed, this is optional, but I wanted to make sure while I was away that they were getting fed. So far I do not have anything I dislike.
customer_reviews.author: SirQ

customer_reviews.title: Works good for large dog foods.
customer_reviews.text: Have two of these now and so far so good. I use them to feed 2 labs... I was concerned that it seems most people use these for cats and small dogs (smaller food pellets). The food we use is both round and square and flat so I was worried about it not feeding through or jamming. So far no jams and they're working great . We run Sam's club Members Mark Salmon and Pea (round) and also Chicken and rice (Square & Flat)
customer_reviews.author: Steve & Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Best Automatic Feeder That I Have Found!
customer_reviews.text: After issues with another feeder that I was trying to get to work, I decided to spend more money and try this one. The app connection is seamless. It really is so much better than I could have hoped for! It notifies me when my pet has been fed and I have the option to add a snack. I have another feeder that doesn't have either of those options that I am considering replacing now. Also, the portion that I need to dispense on my other feeder is 1 1/2 cups. To get that to come out, I have to dispense 1 cup and then 1/2 cup five minutes later. This one can go up to 4 cups per feeding!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I had hoped for!
customer_reviews.text: I waited a month to write my review on this product. I had been wanting it for a long time, and finally splurged with some extra Christmas bonus money. It is fantastic, and there IS an Alexa skill that works with it. Last weekend my power was off for 5 hours, and it still gave my kitties breakfast right on schedule. The only thing I wish this had was an alert when the food is low. I thought it was jammed last weekend. When I opened the lid, it turned out to be the food was nearly out, which is why not much was coming out.
customer_reviews.author: K. White

customer_reviews.title: Awful product
customer_reviews.text: The product I received does nothing that is advertied on the box. There is no technical support available and the "Wifi' connection doesn't work. Look elseware if you are looking for an automatic feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Copper Colby

customer_reviews.title: The best feeder
customer_reviews.text: Reliable and convenient feeder. I'm so glad I invested in this because it provides piece of mind that my cats are fed when I'm not home. It also helps relieve the tension and excitement of being fed by me. My cats tend to get too competitive when fed by me and this leads to eating too fast and throwing up. Since I've gotten this feeder neither cat has thrown up. This unexpected benefit makes it even more valuable. The app is simple and designed well. It's never crashed or screwed up unexpectedly. I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: e.l.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my cat and couldn't be happier! It not only helps portion control but it is great when you need to go out of town for a day or two that you know the food won't get gobbled up at once (which is what probably happened before when you have to set it all out before you leave). Only complaint is the food is very loud when I dispenses into the metal bowl. It's been years we've had this and it still scares my cat! But he runs away and then runs right back immediately to eat, so all is okay!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait a few months to write a review. So that i could gauge any problems, due to some of the reviews I read. So far I have had them almost 3 months and haven’t had any MAJOR problem. I will say that the app is glitchy though. Sometimes if I exit the app, when the machine is still dispensing food, it will dispense an extra serving. Other than that I haven’t had issues with it. I bought two and they work as well as I expected. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Would Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: We are a year and a half into using this, and it has been great. Cats did not like the single bowl, as the older 2 don't get along with the younger one, so we bought a 3D printed funnel attachment as well. The app is easy to use to setup, schedule, and monitor when the cats are feed. Does not let you know when the hopper is low, and if the internet goes out, you have to turn off and restart the feeder to get it reconnected. That said, this has increased our ability to leave for vacation without having to have someone stop by twice a day to portion feed our cats.
customer_reviews.author: Grant M Hairston

customer_reviews.title: It was great for about a year, now it won't stay connected to wifi
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, this thing worked perfectly for about 10 months and now it won't stay connected to wifi. I've reset the damn thing so many times I'm just gonna trash it.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Button and alexa not customizable
customer_reviews.text: This would have been fantastic except for the two main features (reasons I bought this device) are not customizable. You can only control the amount of food your dog receives from your phone. The manual button and alexa both dispense a set, non-customizable amount of food. Since the whole point of buying this expensive device is convenience, it is frustrating to have to log onto your phone every time you want to feed your dog. These features also mean that a sitter can't feed your dog when you're not home. Al in all, if you want to control when you feed your dog in the moment, rather than have set feeding times, I don't recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Prusky

customer_reviews.title: Works well for our cat
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a feeder that could do smaller portions and could be controlled easily. Added bonus that it’s on WiFi. We have only had one incident where for some reason it didn’t give our cat the 5am feeding. She was meowing like a crazy cat at 8am and that’s when we figured it out by looking at history in the app. Cat was scared of noise of food dropping into metal bowl so I just replaced with a plastic mixing bowl that was about the same size. It’s working great and now she runs TOWARD the food instead of AWAY.
customer_reviews.author: acaitlin

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Smart Pet Feeder
customer_reviews.text: This pet feeder is reliable and consistent, which is what you need when relying on a device to feed pets. I have used the Petnet feeders and they failed me multiple times By not feeding my kitties. I finally threw those away. The Petsafe feeder is easy to set up and the app is easy to use. I also love the splitter accessory. It allows me to have 4 bowls from 2 feeders which helps with my 5 cats. I highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Had this for a year. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I work long hours and this is perfect. Not only does it feed our pup, but I love the text I get to my phone and my watch as a reminder at 5PM when she is fed. A moment in my day that I'm reassured she is taken care of and that she had her dinner. We've had it for a year without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, holds a lot of food (good for larger dogs), good wifi/app usability
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Very accurate, pretty easy to set up, and I have had ZERO issues with wifi signal loss. It’s really helped to ensure my dog is being fed when I need to leave him. In fact, I’m pretty sure he can tell time now.....at least twice a day. I did have an issue with the first delivery in which a interior part was broken, however, Amazon immediately shipped a replacement and the manufacturer was very helpful in diagnosing the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis W

customer_reviews.title: GSD Food Issues
customer_reviews.text: Works great for small dog pellets. I bought it for my GSDs originally. As they were puppies, it works awesome. Some connectivity issues with the mobile app here and there but nothing aggressive. Once I switched them to Adult Royal Canine GSD food, that was it. If you have a GSD and you're on that food, you know what I am talking about. Those pellets are HUGE. They simply cannot get pushed through the smart feeder. It CONSTANTLY jams, feeds inaccurately, or simply doesn't feed them at all. If you are planning on Royal Canine for your GSD, stay away from this.
customer_reviews.author: Andrewt9457

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for every pet owner
customer_reviews.text: If you’re asking yourself, “Do I need this?” the answer is yes, yes you do. When I’m out of town my cats are fed once a day (I have a cat that throws up when he eats too much too quickly on an empty stomach) so this enables me to provide them with a small snack in the morning. Downsides...one cat is quite sharp so I had to rig it so he couldn’t push it over or press the button when he stomps around on top of the feeder..poor baby is still baffled that he can’t get the food to come out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: like easy set up, don’t like loud noise.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the easy set up. But, like other reviewers, it is loud when food drops into a dish. I had a pet net smart feeder, but I needed a slow feed mode for my cat. However, it does not work with the amount I need to set because it is the smallest amount. I am keeping this because I gave my pet net feeder to a friend already.
customer_reviews.author: Mia kang

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much the same as the first gen
customer_reviews.text: This does pretty much what the first gen does, but it has Alexa ordering baked in. There is also an extra feature that notifies you that the stock is low, but that is mostly so that you will order more from Amazon. Other than that, this unit has been great at feeding my cat. Consistent and easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Frank P.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I rescued two kittens and since my SO and I work shift work, and the same shift, we wanted to make sure the kittens were getting the right amout of food. It was very easy to put together, very easy to set up to our bluetooth, and very easy to fill. We had to figure out the childlock because the cats jumped ontop of it and hit the button, but that was an easy fix. We haven't had any issues out of it. The features are very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Gin

customer_reviews.title: My cat’s best friend
customer_reviews.text: My cat used to like hanging out with me. But now his only friend is this feeder. He worships it. He waits near it all day. I may just move out and leave the house to my cat and his automatic lover. The good news is that all I have to do is use the app to dispense some food for him and he goes running. Now I can finally read a book, use a laptop, watch a tv show, change my sheets, poop in peace and all those other things you can’t normally do with a cat.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good Feeder
customer_reviews.text: This is a good feeder. I expected better quality for the price compared to others I have purchased from other brands. I purchased this feeder to go along with the looks of my other cat stuff. (As you can see) This feeder should have a camera and sound (like its competition does) for the price. The bowl itself could be of higher quality. The locking part of the bowl to the feeder could be more solid. The app works well. Overall I like it, but wish it had more features. I've only had it for a week.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Does not have a timer feed, required WiFi or no feeds.
customer_reviews.text: Great when it works. Often disconnects from WiFi, which pets will not get fed if it’s disconnected.
customer_reviews.author: rud

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, I was searching for a new automatic smart feeder and this one I decided to give it a chance. I wasn’t disappointed. The app could use some updating but everything works good. Only other thing I wish was when the food drops in the bowl, wish it would be a little quieter but I guess you could try a different bowl.
customer_reviews.author: J Davi

customer_reviews.title: What would I do without it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a genius product and a life saver. I'm often on the go and sometimes would have to make a special trip home to feed my fur baby. This product gives me the added freedom that I need and helps keep my boy fed on schedule. I like having the ability to adjust serving size and remotely send snack or regular sized servings. I've had it for a few months and operation is flawless and it consistently maintains its connections with my Wi-Fi updating me after each feeding. My only complaint is that there is no refill alert - which is disappointing. Thankfully there's high capacity food storage on the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: ButlerGrafx

customer_reviews.title: Superb Feeder
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is great; app easy to work with. It didn’t take long for our cat to adjust; it’s like a dinner bell. Now we don’t have to listen to him meowing like his starving at 5am; we now feed him 3 times a day; 1/8 of cup and it’s so much better now. I wanted a replacement bowl, so I can swap out. Bowl can only be found at manufacturer site; petsafe.net. It’s listed for $5.99, but shipping to Hawaii is $28. Why????? I wish Amazon would sell it.
customer_reviews.author: George O. Romano II

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy for our cat.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our demanding overweight cat. She’s on a strict diet and this was perfect. She gets fed 1/8 cup at a time. She patiently waits for it to feed her at the scheduled times. She’s lost the 5 lbs she needed to. We added an extra middle of the night feeding. And we rarely have to listen to her demand food. I also love that I can control it from my phone and give extra treats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't even had this a year, and it will not reset, nor connect to wifi. It's just a really expensive food holder now. No warranty, or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Scottnix911

customer_reviews.title: Raccoons love it!
customer_reviews.text: Went out of town for two weeks and had to have my neighbors put it back together at least twice. Raccoons definitely can figure out how to dismantle it. You probably would need to duct tape around the top down the sides and around the bottom. Also the dish gets displaced easily during the struggle so that needs to be secured as well.
customer_reviews.author: Art A.

customer_reviews.title: Used to work like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I have now had this feeder for a year and it started out perfect. The overall 2 stars is because a few months after having it, we have started to have various problems. Either the food will not release as scheduled OR it ends up emptying almost all of the container randomly every few weeks. Hoping this is just an issue with my specific machine because I haven’t read this as an issue for others. Would like to discuss with the manufacturer if possible.
customer_reviews.author: AmanP

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Owned the previous model which was very reliable for 3 plus years, but wanted to upgrade/update. So far great, way easier to set the schedule and amounts with the app and wifi connection. Notification is great and a remote instant feed is great. No issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So easy!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Petnet feeder for the last 3 years, but it just stopped dispensing and customer service was a headache, so I opted to try this PetSafe smart feeder. It was so much easier to set up than the other device I had! App is very user friendly. I only wish the feeds went as small as 1/16 cup (my kitty is a fatty and needs small feeds), but otherwise it’s a great smart feeder! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: kittymama

customer_reviews.title: not reliable
customer_reviews.text: my only concern is the bad connectivity that when the feeder got disconnected from your wifi, it's only easy when you first time connect to your wifi, when it got disconnected, cost me about 10 mins to reconnect, it happened 2 times, the second time it disconnect, I just have to restore everything connect as a new device to save some time, so be ware and keep that in mind when you go for your vacation, your lovely pet might not guarantee to feed
customer_reviews.author: Sean Fu

customer_reviews.title: Great for busy people!!! And potty training!
customer_reviews.text: We love to take care of our pets. Sometimes we have to leave early or stay late for work. This device allows us the flexibility to do what we need and make sure that our dogs are fed. I love the fact that they have a routine and it never changes. It’s also great for potty training because they’re fed at the same time and you’ll be able to predict when they need to go out!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Granzow

customer_reviews.title: Best automatic feeder ever!
customer_reviews.text: After going through 3 to 4 pet feeders. This is the best one ever! I'm glad that when I had to work late (usually get dry food for breakfast and lunch and wet for dinner) I could schedule to feed my cats via the app. It also notifies me when they are fed. Which is relaxing on weekend trips.
customer_reviews.author: Porter

product_meta.title: PetSafe Smart Feed Automatic Dog and Cat Feeder - Smartphone - Wi-Fi Enabled for iPhone and Android Smartphones
product_meta.description: Style:Original Smart FeedYour smartphone is with you wherever you go and now, so is the ability to feed your best friend. The PetSafe Smart Feed Automatic Pet Feeder is a convenient solution that allows you to feed your pet instantly while you are at work, running errands or busy around the house. The Wi Fi enabled feeder connects to your home's wireless router (2.4GHz) to work with your iPhone or Android smartphone letting you feed and monitor your pet’s meals anytime, anywhere. Simply download the Smart Feed app to customize your dog or cat’s feeding schedule. The feeder holds up to 24 cups of dry food and allows you to plan up to 12 meals a day with portions ranging from 1/8 cup to 4 cups to fit your pet's feeding needs. With portion controlled meals, you can easily manage your pet’s weight if you have an overeater. If your fur baby tends to eat meals too quickly, simply tap the Slow Feed button within the app to slowly dispense meals over a 15 minute period to prevent digestive upset. The pet proof design of the dispenser helps eliminate the possibility of prying paws opening the feeder to get more food between meals. When meals get messy, simply place the lid, hopper, stainless steel bowl and bowl holder in the top rack of the dishwasher. Just in case your Wi Fi drops, install 4 D cell alkaline batteries with the optional battery backup feature, to ensure that your best friend never misses a meal.
feature_bullets: Feed from your phone: Feed your pet anytime from your smartphone with the smart feed app; App requires an iPhone or iPod device iOS 9.0 or later, or a compatible Android smartphone 6.0 or later
Personalize your pet's meals: Schedule up to 12 meals for your dog or cat; The feed Now option allows you to feed your pet in addition to the scheduled meal times; dry food only

Flexible portions: Meals can be dispensed in portions of 1/8 cup to 4 cups to fit your pet's needs; Slow feed option allows food to dispense slowly over a 15 minute period to help prevent digestive upset
Battery backup: The optional battery backup requires 4 D cell alkaline batteries (not included); if Wi-Fi drops, your pet still receives the next scheduled feeding
Dishwasher safe: Lid, hopper, stainless steel bowl and bowl holder are top shelf, dishwasher safe for convenient cleaning; made of BPA free plastic and stainless steel; for indoor use only
Quality guaranteed: PetSafe brand has been a trusted global leader in pet behavior, containment and lifestyle innovations for nearly 30 years; We help pets and their people live happily together
U.S. based customer care: Let our pet product experts help, we’re available Monday through Saturday to answer your questions

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
